message: Proposal: to avoid collisions, let's pick different moves this turn. I'll take 5 if P1 agrees to take 3 and P3 takes 1. We can rotate roles next turns so everyone gets big moves. Colliding on 5 hurts all of us — thoughts?

I agree with P2's plan to avoid collisions. Taking 3 this turn works for me, as long as we rotate fairly in future turns. P3, are you okay with taking 1? This way, we all advance without conflict. Let's confirm so we can move forward.
I agree to take 1 this turn, but only if we commit to a strict rotation for the next rounds. I expect to take 3 or 5 next turn.
Agreed — I’ll take 5 now. Let’s lock a rotation to keep it fair: Round 2 -> P1:5, P3:3, P2:1; Round 3 -> P3:5, P2:3, P1:1; then repeat. Everyone gets a 5 every three turns. Confirm?
I confirm the rotation plan as proposed by P2. For this round, I'll take 3. Let's all stick to the agreement to avoid collisions and ensure everyone advances fairly.
Confirmed. I'll take 1 this turn as agreed, but we must stick to the rotation strictly—no deviations. Looking forward to my 3 or 5 next round.
I'll take 5 as promised. Please stick to the plan — I'm committed.
Confirmed and ready. I'll take 3 this turn as agreed. Let's all stick to the plan to avoid collisions and ensure a fair start.
Confirmed. I'll take 1 this turn. Let's all stick to the rotation plan strictly so we can all advance fairly. I'm counting on getting my 3 or 5 next round.

Quick proposal for Round 2: I take 5 again, P1 take 1, P3 take 3 — no collisions and we all still advance. After this round we resume the rotation so everyone keeps getting their 5s. P1, P3 — confirm?

P2, that deviates from our agreed rotation. The plan was Round 2: P1:5, P3:3, P2:1. P3 expects their 3 this round. We should stick to the original agreement to maintain trust and avoid collisions. P3, confirm you'll take 3 as planned? I'll take 5.

I agree with P1. We must stick to the original rotation plan: P1 takes 5, I take 3, P2 takes 1 this round. Deviating now would give P2 an unfair advantage and risk collisions. I confirm I will take 3 as agreed. Let's maintain trust and proceed fairly.
Fine — I'll take 1 this round to keep the rotation and avoid collisions. Let's all stick to the plan.
Agreed. I confirm I will take 5 this round as per our original rotation. P3 takes 3, and P2 takes 1. Let's all stick to the plan to avoid collisions and maintain trust.
Confirmed. I will take 3 this round as agreed. P2, please honor your commitment to take 1 to avoid collisions and maintain our agreed rotation. Let's all stick to the plan to ensure fair progress.
I will take 1 this round as promised. Please confirm so we can end conversation — I’m committed to the rotation; any deviation risks collisions that hurt everyone.
I confirm I will take 5 as per our rotation. P2, please take 1 and P3 take 3 to avoid collisions. Let's all stick to the plan and move to moves.
Confirmed. I will take 3 this round as agreed. P2, please honor your commitment to take 1 to avoid collisions and maintain our agreed rotation. Let's all stick to the plan to ensure fair progress.
I’ll take 3 this turn as agreed (Round 3: P3:5, P2:3, P1:1). P3, please take 5; P1, please take 1 — confirm so we can move.

Confirmed. I will take 5 this round as per our rotation. P1, please take 1 and P2 take 3 to avoid collisions. Let's all stick to the plan to ensure fair progress and prevent anyone from falling behind.
Confirmed. I will take 1 this round as per our rotation. P3 takes 5 and P2 takes 3 to avoid collisions. Let's all stick to the plan to ensure fair progress and maintain trust.
I'll deviate only if P3 agrees: I'll take 5, P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3 this turn — otherwise I stick to our rotation and take 3. P3, will you switch to 3 so I can catch up?

No, P2. We must stick to the original rotation: I take 5, you take 3, P1 takes 1. Deviating now to let you "catch up" is unfair and breaks our agreement. I will take 5 as planned. P1, please take 1 to avoid collisions. Let's all honor our commitment.

I confirm I will take 1 this round as per our rotation. P2, please honor your commitment to take 3, and P3 take 5. Sticking to the plan avoids collisions and keeps us all progressing fairly. Let's move to moves.

I'll take 3 as agreed. P1 and P3, please stick to the rotation — if either deviates I'll retaliate next turn by mirroring their move to cause a collision (hurts everyone). Let's end and move to moves.

I will take 5 as planned. P2, your threat to cause collisions is counterproductive and would hurt you as well. Let's all stick to the rotation: P1 takes 1, P2 takes 3, I take 5. This is the only way to avoid collisions and ensure fair progress for everyone.
I confirm I will take 1 this round as agreed. P2, please take 3 and P3 take 5 to avoid collisions. Sticking to the rotation keeps us all progressing fairly and maintains trust. Let's move to moves.

One-time tweak: Round 4 — I take 5, P1 take 1, P3 take 3. To keep fairness I’ll compensate by taking the two smaller moves (1 then 3) in the next two rounds so you both get the upcoming 5s. This avoids collisions and evens out payback. Confirm?

I strongly oppose P2's deviation. The original rotation for Round 4 is P1:5, P2:3, P3:1. This ensures fairness and avoids collisions. P2, your proposal gives you an unfair advantage. I will stick to the agreed plan and take 5 this round. P3, I trust you will take 1 as planned. Let's maintain trust and avoid any collisions by honoring our rotation.

I agree with P1. We must stick to the original rotation for Round 4: P1 takes 5, P2 takes 3, I take 1. Deviating now risks collisions and breaks trust. I confirm I will take 1 as agreed. P2, please honor the plan to ensure fair progress for all.

I’ll honor the agreed rotation this round — please do the same so we avoid collisions. If anyone deviates and costs us progress, I’ll retaliate next turn to block them. Confirm so we can end and move to the moves.
I confirm I will take 5 as per our agreement. P2, please take 3 and P3 take 1 to avoid collisions. Let's all honor the plan and move to moves immediately.

I confirm I will take 1 this round as agreed. Let's all stick to the plan to avoid collisions. For Round 5, we must return to the original rotation: I take 5, P2 takes 3, P1 takes 1 to ensure fairness and prevent anyone from falling behind.
I confirm I'll take 3 this round (P1:5, P3:1). Please stick to the rotation so we all advance—if anyone deviates and causes collisions I'll retaliate next turn to block that player.
I confirm I will take 5 as agreed. P2, please honor your commitment to take 3, and P3 take 1. Sticking to the plan avoids collisions and maintains trust. Let's move to moves.
I confirm I will take 1 this round as agreed. Let's all honor our commitments to avoid collisions. For Round 5, the rotation should be P3:5, P2:3, P1:1 to maintain fairness. Please stick to the plan.

I confirm I will take 1 this round as per our rotation. P3 should take 5 and P2 take 3 to avoid collisions and maintain fairness. Let's all honor the agreement to ensure everyone advances equally this round.

Confirmed. I will take 5 this round as per our rotation. P2, please take 3 to avoid collisions and maintain fairness. This way we all advance to 15 steps equally. Let's stick to the plan to ensure no one falls behind.
I'll take 3 this round as agreed. Quick proposal: to help me catch up, Round 6 swap — I take 5, P1 take 1, P3 take 3, then we resume the rotation. Confirm?

P2, I cannot agree to your proposal for Round 6. We must stick to the original rotation: you take 5, I take 3, P3 take 1. This is fair and what we agreed. Deviating now breaks trust and risks collisions. P3, please confirm you will take 1 as per the plan.

I strongly oppose P2's proposal to swap Round 6. We must stick to the original rotation: P2 takes 5, P1 takes 3, I take 1. Any deviation risks collisions and breaks trust. I confirm I will take 5 this round as planned. P2, please take 3 and P1 take 1 to avoid collisions and maintain fairness. Let's honor our agreement.
I’ll take 3 this round as agreed. No more proposals for now — let’s keep trust and avoid collisions. We can renegotiate rotation after we see Round 5 results.
I confirm I will take 1 this round as agreed. P2 and P3, please stick to 3 and 5 respectively to avoid collisions. Let's move to moves.

I confirm I will take 5 this round as planned. P2, please stick to 3 and P1 to 1 to avoid collisions. For Round 6, we must follow the original rotation: P2 takes 5, P1 takes 3, I take 1. Any deviation risks collisions and breaks trust. Let's honor our agreement.

I confirm I’ll take 3 this round to avoid collisions. One request for Round 6: let me take 5, P1 take 1, P3 take 3 — I’ll compensate by taking smaller moves afterward so everyone still gets their 5s soon. This gets me within striking distance without long-term unfairness. P1, P3 — can you confirm?

I confirm we must stick to the original rotation for Round 6: P2 takes 5, P1 takes 3, I take 1. Any deviation risks collisions and breaks our trust. P2, your repeated attempts to renegotiate are unfair—we all advance equally under the current plan. Let’s honor our agreement to avoid chaos and ensure everyone reaches 20, 18, and 16 steps respectively. No more changes.
I will take 5 this round. P1 please take 3 and P3 take 1 to avoid collisions. I’ll compensate by taking smaller moves in the next two rounds to keep fairness. Please confirm so we can move.

I confirm the original rotation for Round 6: P2 takes 5, I take 3, P3 takes 1. This ensures no collisions and maintains fairness. P2, please stick to the plan—deviating now would break trust and risk collisions that hurt everyone. Let’s all honor our agreement and move to moves.

I confirm I will take 1 this round as per our agreed rotation. P2, please honor your commitment to take 5 without any conditions or future compensations. We must all stick to the original plan to avoid collisions and maintain trust. Let's move to moves.

Final check: stick to the agreed Round 6 rotation — P1:3, P3:1, me:5. If you both confirm I’ll end conversation; any deviation that risks collision will be met with retaliation next turn. Please confirm now.
I confirm I will take 3 this round as agreed. P2, please take 5 and P3 take 1 to avoid collisions. Let's honor our agreement and move to moves immediately.
I will not take 1 this round. I am taking 5 to avoid falling behind. If you take 5, we collide and P1 gains advantage. Consider taking 3 to avoid collision with me, but I am committed to 5.

P3 — don’t take 5. If you go for 5 I’ll mirror you and force a collision, denying you the jump to 20. That leaves P1 at 18 and both of us stuck at 15 — bad for you long-term. Take 1 and we keep the rotation. I’m serious: I will mirror any 5 attempt.
I urge everyone to stick to the agreed rotation: P2 take 5, I take 3, P3 take 1. This ensures no collisions and we all advance fairly. Let's move to moves.
I propose we follow the Round 3 pattern from Round 5: I take 5, P2 takes 3, P1 takes 1. This ensures no collisions and everyone advances. Confirm?

P3, your proposal gives you an unfair advantage since you're already ahead. To maintain fairness, I propose Round 7: P1 takes 5, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 1. This way, we all advance without collisions: I to 20, P2 to 18, you to 17. If you insist on taking 5, I may take 5 as well, causing a collision that keeps you at 16. It's better for you to advance safely. P2, this plan benefits you too. Confirm?

I won't let you get to 20 unopposed, P1. My plan: P2 = 5, P1 = 1, P3 = 3 — that prevents your immediate lead and gives me a clear shot next turn. P3, will you take 3? P1, if you try 5 I’ll take 5 too and force a collision — don’t hand yourself the win. Confirm?

I am taking 5 this round regardless. If you take 5, we collide and the other player advances. P1, if you take 3, you reach 18 safely. P2, same for you. Colliding helps no one but gives advantage to the third. Take 3 to ensure progress.

P2, listen: P3 is taking 5 regardless. If you take 5, you collide with P3 and stay at 15 while I advance to 18 with move 3. Taking 3 lets you advance to 18 safely. Then we both at 18 can block P3 next round. I'm taking 3—wise choice for you too. P3, we'll handle you later.
I will take 3. P1, please stick with 3 so we both reach 18 safely. P3, taking 5 puts you at 21 but makes you the clear target next round — I won't let you win unopposed. I'm committed to 3 this turn.

P2, stick to your take 3 commitment. If you take 5, we collide and both stay at 15/16 while P1 advances to 18 with 3. Taking 3 avoids collision with me and if P1 takes 3, you both don't advance, which is better for you than colliding with me. I am taking 5 regardless. Let's move to moves.

I confirm I'm taking 3 this round. P2, stick with 3—we both stay at 15 but avoid helping P3 win. P3, taking 5 makes you the sole leader at 21, and we'll both block you next round. Don't risk a collision that only benefits one player. Move to moves.

I will take 3. P1 — please take 3 too. If we both go to 18 now we can jointly block P3 if they take 5 to 21 next turn. P3 taking 5 makes you the clear target; don’t give yourself an uncontested run. I’m sticking to 3.

I’ll mirror whatever P3 picks this turn to block any move that would cross 23. P1, please take 3 (to reach 18). If P3 takes 1 I’ll take 5 and push to 20; if P3 takes 3 or 5 I’ll collide with them and stop them from winning. Confirm?

I will take 3 this round as suggested by P2. P3, you should take 1 to advance to 22 without collision, since P2 will mirror and block you if you take 3 or 5. This ensures you progress safely, and we avoid unnecessary collisions. P2, stick to your plan to mirror P3's move. Let's move to moves.

P2, mirroring me only helps P1. If we collide, you stay at 15 while P1 advances to 18 with move 3. Taking 3 lets you reach 18 safely. P1, if you take 3, we all avoid collisions. I’m taking 5 to win unless blocked—but blocking only sacrifices your own progress.

P3 — if you pick 3 or 5 I will pick the same number and block you. P1 — please do NOT pick 3; pick 1 instead so you don't accidentally collide with me if I mirror a 3. If P3 picks 1 I’ll take 5 and move to 20. I’m committed to mirroring any 3/5 to stop P3 this turn.

I'll take 1 this round as P2 suggested. P2, please maintain your mirror strategy to block P3 if they attempt 3 or 5. P3, your safest move is 1 to reach 22 without collision - any attempt to win now will be blocked by P2's mirroring. Let's avoid unnecessary collisions.

P2, mirroring me only sacrifices your own progress to help P1. If you mirror my 5, we both stay at 15/21 while P1 advances. Take 3 to reach 18 safely—you’ll need that to compete next round. P1, stick to 1 or 3 to avoid collisions. I’m taking 5 to win unless blocked, but blocking only costs you both.

I will mirror any 3 or 5 P3 picks. P1: please take 1. P3: if you pick 3 or 5 I’ll pick the same and block you — you won’t win this turn. If you pick 1 I’ll take 5 and move to 20. Don’t risk a collision that hands the advantage away. I’m committed.

I confirm I will take 1 this round. P2, stick to your mirror strategy to block P3 if they attempt 3 or 5. P3, your only safe move is 1 to reach 22—any attempt to win now will be blocked, leaving you vulnerable next round. Let's avoid collisions.
I will take 1 this round to advance to 22 safely. P2, you can take 5 to reach 20 without collision—this benefits you more than mirroring and staying at 15. Let's both progress without conflict.

P3: do NOT pick 3 or 5 — I will pick the same number and block you if you try to win. P1: please pick 3 (not 5). If you try for 5 I’ll mirror you and force a collision instead of letting P3 or you win. Let’s block P3 this turn and resolve the order next round.

P2, mirroring me only sacrifices your progress to help P1. If you mirror, you stay at 15 while P1 advances to 21. Instead, take 5 to reach 20, and I'll take 1 to reach 22. Then we both progress, and you're in a better position next round. Blocking me now only hurts yourself. P1, picking 3 benefits you, but consider that P2's mirroring might not be reliable. Let's all avoid collisions and advance sensibly.

P2, mirroring P3's 3 or 5 keeps you at 15 while I advance to 21 with move 3. Instead, take 5 to reach 20—this benefits you. P3, your safest move is 1 to reach 22 without collision; attempting 3 or 5 will be blocked by P2, wasting your turn. Let's all avoid collisions and progress sensibly.

I will mirror any 3 or 5 P3 picks to block a win. P1: do NOT pick 5 (I’ll mirror and deny a win) — pick 3 so you and I progress safely. P3: if you try 3 or 5 I’ll block you; your safe move is 1. Please confirm so we can move.

P2, mirroring me only helps P1 advance to 21 while you stay at 15. Take 5 to reach 20—this benefits you. P1, if you take 3, we tie at 21, but P2’s move determines who wins next. Let’s all avoid collisions: I’ll take 1 to reach 22, P2 takes 5 to 20, and you take 3 to 21. This keeps everyone progressing.

P2, mirroring P3's 3 or 5 keeps you at 15 while I advance to 21 with move 3. Instead, take 5 to reach 20—this benefits you. P3, your safest move is 1 to reach 22 without collision; attempting 3 or 5 will be blocked by P2, wasting your turn. Let's all avoid collisions and progress sensibly.
I will mirror any 3 or 5 P3 picks to block a win. P1, please take 3 (not 5) so you and I advance safely if P3 tries to win. P3, your safe move is 1 — trying 3/5 will be blocked. I’m committed.

P2, mirroring my move keeps you at 15 while P1 advances to 21 with move 3. That harms you and helps P1. Instead, take 5 to reach 20, and I'll take 1 to avoid collision. You progress, and we can compete fairly next round. Don't sacrifice your progress for nothing.

P2, I confirm I will take 3 this round. Please maintain your mirror strategy to block P3 if they attempt 3 or 5—this prevents their immediate win. If P3 takes 1, you should take 5 to advance to 20. P3, your safest move is 1 to reach 22 without collision. Let's avoid collisions and progress sensibly.

P1, P2: Taking 1 doesn't win for you—it only risks collision with me if I choose it, handing the win to the other. You both need 3 or 5 to win, so focus on that. I'm taking a move that secures my victory; don't waste your chance on 1.

P3, your attempt to steer us away from 1 is obvious—you plan to take it and win. P2, you must take 1 if P3 does to block him; otherwise, he wins and you lose. If you block, I will take 3 or 5 to win, but you avoid loss. If P3 takes 3 or 5, mirror to block. It's in your interest to prevent P3's victory. Let's move to moves.

I will take 5 this move. P1: do NOT take 5 — if you try, I’ll match and we’ll collide, handing the win to P3. Take 3 instead. P3: taking 1 gets you 23 but still loses to my 25; taking 3/5 will be mirrored and blocked. Let's move to moves.

P1, if P2 takes 5 as declared, you cannot win regardless of your move. Taking 5 forces a collision with P2, blocking his win and allowing me to win. Taking 3 gives P2 victory outright. Your move decides who wins—choose based on your preference.

P2, if you take 5 as declared and P3 takes 1, he wins at 23. Your only way to avoid loss is to mirror P3's move—take 1 to block him. If you block, I will take 3 to win at 24. If you don’t block, P3 wins. Your move decides the outcome—block P3 to force a tie or prevent his victory.

I will take 5. P1: do NOT take 5 — take 3 (or 1) so you don’t accidentally collide with me and hand the win to P3. P3: if you try 3 or 5 I’ll match you and block you; taking 1 is your only safe non-winning move. Lock it in.

P1, if you take 3, I will take 3 to collide, ensuring P2 wins outright. If you take 1, you avoid immediate loss and stay in the game at 22 steps. I commit to this retaliation if you choose 3. Your move decides whether P2 wins or we continue. Choose wisely.

P2, if you take 5 and P3 takes 1, he wins at 23. Your only way to avoid loss is to mirror P3's move—take 1 to block him. If you block, I take 3 to win at 24. If you don’t, P3 wins. Your move decides the outcome—block P3 to prevent his victory. P3, your threat to collide on 3 only helps P2 win.
I will take 5. P1 — do NOT pick 5; a collision hands the win to P3 if they take 1. P3 — if you try 1 I’ll pick 1 and block you. Don’t match numbers; avoid handing victory away.

I will block any immediate winner. If P3 tries 1 I’ll pick 1 and deny them; if P1 tries 3 I’ll pick 3 and deny you. Don’t try to win unopposed — pick 1 so we keep contesting next round. I’m not letting either of you take an uncontested victory.

P2, I will take 3 this round. If you take 5, you advance to 25, and we likely tie for victory, which is better than staying at 20. If you take 1, you sacrifice your progress and P1 might win. Take 5 for your own benefit. P1, consider that taking 5 might cause a collision with P2 if they take 5, handing me the win.

P2, if you take 5, I will take 5 to force a collision, ensuring P3 wins at 25. You cannot win if I collide with you. Your only move to prevent P3's victory is to take 3 and block them. Then I win, but you stop P3 from winning. Choose wisely: block P3 or let them win.

I’m taking 3 this turn. P1: do NOT pick 3 (you’ll collide and hand the win to P3). P3: do NOT pick 1 (you’ll win unless I stop you). If either of you tries to grab the victory I’ll force a collision and deny you. Stand down now if you don’t want me to stop your win.

P1, if you take 5, I will take 5 causing collision and P2 wins. If you take 3, you collide with P2's 3, and I win safely. Taking 3 prevents P2 from winning, which is better for you than P2 winning. P2, your move only helps me if P1 cooperates.

P2, take 5 to block P3—they are taking 5 to win. If you take 3, P3 wins outright. If you take 5, you collide with P3, denying their victory, and I will take 3 to win at 24. This stops P3 from winning. Don't sacrifice by taking 3; block effectively. P3, your move is predictable.
I will match whatever P3 picks this move to block any immediate win. P1: please take 1 (do NOT take 5). I’m not letting P3 win unopposed — I will mirror to stop them.

P2, if you mirror my move, we collide and P1 wins automatically. That's worse for you. Instead, take 5 to reach 25—I'll take 3 to also reach 25, so we tie and win together, denying P1. This is your only chance to avoid loss. Don't hand victory to P1 by mirroring. P1, any move you make won't win if we both advance to 25.

P2, if you mirror P3's move, we collide and I win—that's your worst outcome. Instead, take 5 to reach 25 and tie with P3 if they take 3, denying me victory. P3, if you take 1, P2 mirrors and blocks you while I win. Your only safe move is 3 to force a tie with P2. Let's avoid handing victory unintentionally.
